description: The SYNTHETIC.CAMPAIGNS table represents a business entity that manages marketing campaigns, with each campaign identified uniquely by the CAMPAIGN_ID. Key details include the campaign's name, start and end dates, with fields for budget and other campaign attributes such as EMAIL_131_ATTR_0, EVENT_131_ATTR_1, and AD_131_ATTR_2, which suggest this table tracks various campaign-specific characteristics or metrics. This table stands isolated in terms of relationships as it neither references nor is referenced by any other tables, making it primarily a standalone representation of campaign information in the database.

columns.name: CAMPAIGN_ID
columns.description: This column represents a unique identifier for each campaign within the dataset. It ensures that each campaign can be distinctly recognized and referenced.

columns.name: NAME
columns.description: This column represents the identifier for different campaigns, likely enumerated or named in a sequential manner. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: START_DATE
columns.description: This column likely records the scheduled start date for marketing campaigns within the organization. The data reflects a specific future date and time zone, indicating when a campaign is set to commence.

columns.name: END_DATE
columns.description: This column indicates the planned or actual end date for each campaign. It reflects the date when a campaign may conclude or the period it covers ends, with an absence of a date signifying that the end has not been determined.

columns.name: BUDGET
columns.description: This column represents the monetary allocation for various marketing campaigns. Actual budgets can vary and are not mandatory for every campaign.

columns.name: EMAIL_131_ATTR_0
columns.description: This column represents a numerically coded attribute related to email campaigns. The specific purpose of these codes is unclear from the available data.
